brief: Launch a new real-money online rummy tournament format for Games24x7.

sections.problem_statement: Games24x7 seeks to diversify its online gaming portfolio and increase user engagement by introducing a new real-money rummy tournament format. The current offering lacks variety in competitive play, potentially limiting player retention and revenue growth. This new format aims to capitalize on the popularity of rummy while providing a fresh, exciting tournament experience that will attract both new and existing players, ultimately increasing platform usage and monetization.

goals_and_success_metrics.success_metric: 25% increase in average daily active users within 3 months of launch
15% increase in overall rummy-related revenue within 6 months
10% increase in 30-day retention rate for rummy players
20% increase in new user registrations for rummy within 3 months

user_stories.story: I want to participate in exciting rummy tournaments with flexible buy-ins so I can compete at my comfort level and potentially win real money prizes.
I want to join high-stakes rummy tournaments with substantial prize pools to test my skills against top players and earn significant rewards.
I want to join quick-play rummy tournaments that fit into my schedule, allowing me to enjoy competitive play in short time frames.
I want to create private rummy tournaments where I can invite friends and compete in a more intimate setting.
I want to easily configure and manage various tournament formats to keep the offering fresh and appealing to different player segments.

constraints: Must comply with all applicable online gambling regulations and obtain necessary licenses
Need to ensure fair play and implement robust anti-cheating measures
Platform must handle high concurrent user loads during popular tournament times
Payment processing must be secure and support multiple payment methods
User interface must be intuitive and accessible on both desktop and mobile devices
Tournament structure must be designed to prevent collusion among players

milestones.milestone: Complete tournament format design and rules
Develop and test tournament backend infrastructure
Implement user interface for tournament participation
Conduct closed beta testing with select users
Launch marketing campaign for new tournament format
Official public launch of new rummy tournament format

sections.hypothesis: Introducing a progressive jackpot feature in the new tournament format will significantly increase player engagement and retention.
sections.rationale: Progressive jackpots create excitement and anticipation, encouraging players to participate more frequently and for longer durations. This feature has proven successful in other online gambling formats.
sections.test: Implement the progressive jackpot in a subset of tournaments and compare player engagement metrics (such as average session length, frequency of play, and retention rate) with non-jackpot tournaments over a 3-month period.

sections.hypothesis: Offering a tiered entry fee structure with corresponding prize pools will attract a wider range of players and increase overall participation.
sections.rationale: A diverse entry fee structure caters to players with different bankrolls and risk appetites, potentially expanding the player base and increasing the total number of tournament entries.
sections.test: Launch tournaments with three distinct entry fee tiers (low, medium, high) and analyze the distribution of players across tiers, total entries, and revenue generated compared to single-tier tournaments over a 2-month period.

sections.hypothesis: Implementing a leaderboard system with additional prizes for top performers will boost player motivation and increase the frequency of tournament participation.
sections.rationale: Leaderboards tap into players' competitive nature and provide additional incentives beyond individual tournament prizes, potentially driving more frequent and consistent participation.
sections.test: Introduce a monthly leaderboard system for a select group of tournaments and compare the average number of tournaments played per user, as well as the percentage of returning players, against non-leaderboard tournaments for a 3-month period.

sections.hypothesis: Offering a 'Turbo' tournament format with faster gameplay and shorter duration will appeal to time-constrained players and increase overall tournament participation.
sections.rationale: Many potential players may be deterred by long tournament durations. A faster format could attract busy players and allow for more tournaments to be played in a given time frame.
sections.test: Launch 'Turbo' tournaments alongside standard-length tournaments and compare the number of unique players, total entries, and time-of-day participation patterns between the two formats over a 2-month period.
